member.name: T:AgGrid.Blazor.ColumnDefinition
member.summary: Strongly-typed representation of: https://www.ag-grid.com/javascript-grid-column-properties/

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.ColumnDefinition.HeaderName
member.summary: The name to render in the column header. If not specified and field is specified, the field name will be used as the header name.

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.ColumnDefinition.HeaderClass
member.summary: Class to use for the header cell. Can be a string, array of strings, or function.

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.ColumnDefinition.HeaderTooltip
member.summary: Tooltip for the column header

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.ColumnDefinition.HeaderComponentFramework
member.summary: Custom header component to use for this column.

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.ColumnDefinition.HeaderComponentParams
member.summary: Params to be passed to header component.

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.ColumnDefinition.ToolPanelClass
member.summary: Class to use for the tool panel cell. Can be a string, array of strings, or function.

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.ColumnDefinition.SuppressColumnsToolPanel
member.summary: Set to true if you do not want this column or group to appear in the Columns Tool Panel. Default: false

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.ColumnDefinition.SuppressFiltersToolPanel
member.summary: Set to true if you do not want this column (filter) or group (filter group) to appear in the Filters Tool Panel. Default: false

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.ColumnDefinition.IsFiltered
member.summary: Set to true to use the default filter. Use the FilterFramework for custom filter.

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.ColumnDefinition.Filtered
member.summary: Set standard filter. Use the FilterFramework for custom filter.

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.ColumnDefinition.FilterFramework
member.summary: Filter component to use for this column. Set to true to use the default filter. true for default filter or name your custom filter

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.ColumnDefinition.FilterParams
member.summary: Custom params to be passed to filter component.

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.ColumnDefinition.Flex
member.summary: Used instead of width when the goal is to fill the remaining empty space of the grid. See Column Flex.

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.ColumnDefinition.Hide
member.summary: Set to true for this column to be hidden. You might think it would make more sense to call this field visible and mark it false to hide, but we want all default values to be false and we want columns to be visible by default. Default: false

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.ColumnDefinition.CellStyle
member.summary: The style to give a particular cell. See Cell Style.

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.ColumnDefinition.CellClass
member.summary: The class to give a particular cell. See Cell Class.

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.ColumnDefinition.CellRenderer
member.summary: Set standard cellRenderer to use for this column. Use the CellRendererFramework for custom cell renderer.

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.ColumnDefinition.CellRendererFramework
member.summary: Custom cellRenderer name to use for this column.

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.ColumnDefinition.CellRendererParams
member.summary: Params to be passed to cell renderer component.

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.ColumnDefinition.IsEditable
member.summary: Set to true if this column is editable, otherwise false. Can also be a function to have different rows editable. Default: false

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.ColumnDefinition.CellEditor
member.summary: Set standard cellEditor to use for this column. Use the CellEditorFramework for custom cell editor.

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.ColumnDefinition.CellEditorFramework
member.summary: Custom cellEditor to use for this column.

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.ColumnDefinition.CellEditorParams
member.summary: Params to be passed to cell editor component.

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.ColumnDefinition.SuppressMenu
member.summary: Set to true if no menu should be shown for this column header. Default: false

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.ColumnDefinition.AutoHeight
member.summary: Set to true to have the grid calculate the height of a row based on contents of this column. Default: false

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.ColumnDefinition.WrapText
member.summary: Set to true to have the text wrap inside the cell. Default: false

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.ColumnDefinition.SingleClickEdit
member.summary: Set to true to have cells under this column enter edit mode after single click. Default: false

member.name: T:AgGrid.Blazor.Sorts
member.summary: Sorting options

member.name: T:AgGrid.Blazor.CellRenderers
member.summary: Provided cell renderers

member.name: F:AgGrid.Blazor.CellRenderers.AgAnimateShowChangeCellRendere
member.summary: The previous value is temporarily shown beside the old value with a directional arrow showing increase or decrease in value. The old value is then faded out.

member.name: F:AgGrid.Blazor.CellRenderers.AgAnimateSlideCellRenderer
member.summary: The previous value shown in a faded fashion and slides, giving a ghosting effect as the old value fades and slides away.

member.name: F:AgGrid.Blazor.CellRenderers.AgGroupCellRenderer
member.summary: (ag-Grid Enterprise only): Group Cell Renderer

member.name: T:AgGrid.Blazor.CellEditors
member.summary: Provided cell editors

member.name: F:AgGrid.Blazor.CellEditors.AgTextCellEditor
member.summary: Simple text editor that uses a standard HTML input. This is the default.

member.name: F:AgGrid.Blazor.CellEditors.AgPopupTextCellEditor
member.summary: Same as 'text' but as popup.

member.name: F:AgGrid.Blazor.CellEditors.AgLargeTextCellEditor
member.summary: A text popup for inputting larger, multi-line text.

member.name: F:AgGrid.Blazor.CellEditors.AgSelectCellEditor
member.summary: Simple editor that uses a standard HTML select.

member.name: F:AgGrid.Blazor.CellEditors.AgPopupSelectCellEditor
member.summary: Same as 'select' but as popup.

member.name: F:AgGrid.Blazor.CellEditors.AgRichSelectCellEditor
member.summary: (ag-Grid Enterprise only): A rich select popup that uses row virtualisation.

member.name: T:AgGrid.Blazor.ColumnFilters
member.summary: Types simple filters

member.name: T:AgGrid.Blazor.GridApi
member.summary: Strongly-typed access to: https://www.ag-grid.com/javascript-grid-api/

members.member: specify rows, or all rows by default
specify columns, or all columns by default
skips change detection, refresh everything
the row nodes to redraw

member.name: T:AgGrid.Blazor.GridCallbacks
member.summary: Strongly-typed counterpart of: https://www.ag-grid.com/javascript-grid-callbacks/

member.name: T:AgGrid.Blazor.GridColumnApi
member.summary: Strongly-typed access to: https://www.ag-grid.com/javascript-grid-column-api/

member.name: T:AgGrid.Blazor.GridEvents
member.summary: Strongly-typed counterpart of: https://www.ag-grid.com/javascript-grid-events/

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.GridEvents.SelectionChanged
member.summary: Row selection is changed. Use the grid API to get the new row selected.

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.GridEvents.CellValueChanged
member.summary: Value has changed after editing.

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.GridEvents.RowValueChanged
member.summary: A cell's value within a row has changed. This event corresponds to Full Row Editing only.

member.name: T:AgGrid.Blazor.CellValueChangedDetail
member.summary: Value has changed after editing.

member.name: T:AgGrid.Blazor.RowValueChangedEvent
member.summary: A cell's value within a row has changed. This event corresponds to Full Row Editing only.

member.name: T:AgGrid.Blazor.GridOptions
member.summary: Strongly-typed representation of: https://www.ag-grid.com/javascript-grid-properties/

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.GridOptions.ColumnDefinitions
member.summary: Array of Column Definitions.

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.GridOptions.DefaultColDef
member.summary: A default column definition.

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.GridOptions.UnSortIcon
member.summary: Set to true to show the 'no sort' icon. See Example Custom Sorting. Default: false

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.GridOptions.SuppressMenuHide
member.summary: Set to true to always show the column menu button, rather than only showing when the mouse is over the column header. Default: false

members.member: Type of Row Selection, set to either 'single' or 'multiple'.
Set to true to allow multiple rows to be selected using single click.See Multi Select Single Click.
If true then rows will be deselected if you hold down ctrl + click the row.
If true, row selection won't happen when rows are clicked. Use when you want checkbox selection exclusively.
If true, cells won't be selectable. This means cells will not get keyboard focus when you click on them.
Set to true to enable Range Selection.
How many concurrent data requests are allowed.Default is 2, so server is only ever hit with 2 concurrent requests.
How many pages to hold in the cache.
How many rows to seek ahead when unknown data size.
How many rows to initially allow scrolling to in the grid.

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.GridOptions.AlwaysShowVerticalScroll
member.summary: Set to true to always show the vertical scrollbar. Default: false

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.GridOptions.DebounceVerticalScrollbar
member.summary: Set to true to debounce the vertical scrollbar. Can provide smoother scrolling on older browsers, eg IE. Default: false

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.GridOptions.SuppressHorizontalScroll
member.summary: Set to true to never show the horizontal scroll. This is useful if the grid is aligned with another grid and will scroll when the other grid scrolls. See Aligned Grid as Footer. Default: false

members.member: True - Pagination is enabled. False (Default) - Pagination is disabled.
Number. How many rows to load per page. Default value = 100. If paginationAutoPageSize is specified, this property is ignored. See example Customising Pagination.

True - The number of rows to load per page is automatically adjusted by ag-Grid so each page shows enough rows to just fill the area designated for the grid. False (Default) - paginationPageSize is used. See example Auto Page Size.

True - The out of the box ag-Grid controls for navigation are hidden. This is useful if pagination=true and you want to provide your own pagination controls. False (Default) - when pagination=true It automatically shows at the bottom the necessary controls so that the user can navigate through the different pages. See example Custom Pagination Controls.
Enables Tree Data: https://www.ag-grid.com/javascript-grid-tree-data/

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.GridOptions.SuppressPreventDefaultOnMouseWheel
member.summary: If true, mouse wheel events will be passed to the browser. Useful if your grid has no vertical scrolls and you want the mouse to scroll the browser page. Default: false

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.GridOptions.EnableBrowserTooltips
member.summary: Set to true to use the browser's default tooltip instead of using ag-Grid's Tooltip Component. Default: false

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.GridOptions.DomLayout
member.summary: Switch between layout options. See Printing and Auto Height. Default: 'normal' Options: 'normal', 'autoHeight', 'print'

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.GridOptions.EnsureDomOrder
member.summary: When true, the order of rows and columns in the DOM are consistent with what is on screen. See Accessibility - Row and Column Order. Default: false

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.GridOptions.AlignedGrids
member.summary: A list of grids to treat as Aligned Grids. If grids are aligned then the columns and horizontal scrolling will be kept in sync.

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.GridOptions.SuppressContextMenu
member.summary: Set to true to not show context menu. Use if you don't want to use the default 'right click' context menu. Default: false

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.GridOptions.PreventDefaultOnContextMenu
member.summary: When using suppressContextMenu, you can use the onCellContextMenu function to provide your own code to handle cell contextmenu events. This flag is useful to prevent the browser from showing its default context menu. Default: false

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.GridOptions.AllowContextMenuWithControlKey
member.summary: Allows context menu to show, even when Ctrl key is held down.

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.GridOptions.Icons
member.summary: Icons to use inside the grid instead of the grid's default icons.

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.GridOptions.RowHeight
member.summary: Default Row Height in pixels. Default: 25

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.GridOptions.AnimateRows
member.summary: Set to true to enable Row Animation. Default: false

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.GridOptions.RowStyle
member.summary: The style to give a particular row. See Row Style.

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.GridOptions.RowClass
member.summary: The class to give a particular row. See Row Class.

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.GridOptions.ScrollbarWidth
member.summary: Tell the grid how wide the scrollbar is, which is used in grid width calculations. Set only if using non-standard browser-provided scrollbars, so the grid can use the non-standard size in its calculations.

member.name: P:AgGrid.Blazor.GridOptions.SuppressRowHoverHighlight
member.summary: Set to true to not highlight rows by adding the ag-row-hover CSS class. Default: false

member.name: T:AgGrid.Blazor.DomLayouts
member.summary: Dom layout options

member.name: T:AgGrid.Blazor.IGetRowsParams
member.summary: Params for Infinite Scrolling Datasource, based on: https://www.ag-grid.com/javascript-grid-infinite-scrolling/#datasource-interface

member.name: T:AgGrid.Blazor.IGridDatasource
member.summary: Infinite Scrolling Datasource, based on: https://www.ag-grid.com/javascript-grid-infinite-scrolling/#datasource-interface

members.member: Row Object(aka Row Node) https://www.ag-grid.com/javascript-grid-row-node/#row-object-aka-row-node A Row Node represents one row of data.The Row Node will contain a reference to the data item your application provided as well as other runtime information about the row. The Row Node contains attributes, methods and emits events. Additional attributes are used if the Row Node is a group.
Unique ID for the node. Either provided by the application, or generated by the grid if not.
The data as provided by the application.
The parent node to this node, or empty if top level.
How many levels this node is from the top when grouping.
How many levels this node is from the top when grouping in the UI (only different to 'parent' when property groupRemoveSingleChildren= true.
True if this node is a group node (ie has children).
top' or 'bottom' if pinned row, otherwise null or undefined.
True if this node can flower (ie can be expanded, but has no direct children).
The child flower of this node.
Index of this row with respect to it's parent when grouping. Changes when data is sorted.
True if this is the first child in this group. Changes when data is sorted.
True if this is the last child in this group. Changes when data is sorted.
Used by enterprise row model, true if this row node is a stub. A stub is a placeholder row with loading icon while waiting from row to be loaded.
The row height in pixels.
The row top position in pixels.
If using quick filter, stores a string representation of the row for searching against.
